description: Some of the new — and newly-powerful — faces headed to Washington, including those who won big and others who just squeaked by.
title: New Faces in Congress
title_page: New Faces in Congress - The New York Times
text:
SENATE, UTAH
MIKE LEE
Many politicians have taken to carrying a copy of the Constitution around like a driver’s license, proclaiming a deep love for the document, but Mike Lee, a lawyer from Salt Lake City, came by his professed passion paternally: his father, Rex E. Lee, served as solicitor general under President Ronald Reagan, and Mr. Lee says he attended most of his father’s arguments before the United States Supreme Court. A former clerk for Judge Samuel A. Alito, Mr. Lee, 39, who has never held public office, had strong Tea Party support. He is known among friends for being an uncanny repository for trivia about America and pop culture.
